sen.j: 幣六（へいろく）は、鳥山石燕の妖怪画集『百器徒然袋』にある日本の妖怪。
sen.e: Heiroku is a Japanese specter portrayed in "Hyakki Tsurezure Bukuro" (One hundred bags in idlenss) by Sekien TORIYAMA.

A Heiroku is one of Japanese yokai (ghosts, spirits and monsters) that was portrayed in Sekien TORIYAMA's yokai art collection book: "Hyakki Tsurezure Bukuro" (The Bag of One Hundred Random Demons; the term 'hyakki' in its title is a pun on the usual hyakki, replacing the character for demon which is written as "鬼" in Japanese with a character for vessel written as "器," and sure enough, most of the yokais shown in this book are tsukumogami [a type of Japanese spirits that originate in items or artifacts that have reached their 100th birthday and become alive]).

sen.e: It is portrayed as a strange specter brandishing a ritual wand with pleated paper, and it is regarded as a tsukumo-gami (gods to a variety of things).

sen.e: According to Shigeru MIZUKI, specter cartoonist, et al., "it is the specter who brandishes the paper of message, claiming it an oracle, and spreads false rumor to confuse people."
